com.viaoa.hub
Class HubDetailDelegate

java.lang.Object
  com.viaoa.hub.HubDetailDelegate

public class HubDetailDelegate
extends java.lang.Object

Delegate that manages master/detail functionality for Hubs.

Author:
vvia

Main method for setting Master/Detail relationship.

See Also:
Full Description on Master/Detail Hubs

setMasterObject

public static void setMasterObject(Hub thisHub,
                                   OAObject masterObject,
                                   OALinkInfo liDetailToMaster)
Set the object that "owns" this hub. This is set by OAObject.getHub() and by updateDetail(), when a detail Hub is updated. All changes (adds/removes/replaces) will automatically be tracked.

Example: if a dept object has an emp hub, then it will be the masterObject of the hubEmp. All additions and removes will be tracked for a OADataSource that uses links.

Parameters:
linkInfo - is from the detail object to the master.

setMasterObject

public static void setMasterObject(Hub thisHub,
                                   OAObject masterObject)

getLinkInfoFromDetailToMaster

public static OALinkInfo getLinkInfoFromDetailToMaster(Hub hub)
Returns the OALinkInfo from detail (MANY) to master (ONE).

isMasterNew

public static boolean isMasterNew(Hub thisHub)
Returns true if any of the master hubs above this hub have an active object that is new.

removeDetailHub

public static boolean removeDetailHub(Hub thisHub,
                                      Hub hubDetail)
Used to remove Master/Detail relationships.

getPropertyFromMasterToDetail

public static java.lang.String getPropertyFromMasterToDetail(Hub thisHub)
Used for master/detail Hubs, returns the name of the property from the master Hub to detail Hub.

Example:
If master is Department and Detail is Employee then "Employees", which is from Department.getEmployees()

getPropertyFromDetailToMaster

public static java.lang.String getPropertyFromDetailToMaster(Hub thisHub)
Used for master/detail Hubs, returns the name of the property from the detail Hub to master Hub.

Example:
If master is Department and Detail is Employee then "Department", which is from Employee.getDepartment()

isOwned

public static boolean isOwned(Hub thisHub)
Returns true if this hub of objects is owned by a master object.

getRealHub

public static Hub getRealHub(Hub thisHub)
Get the real hub that this hub should be using. This could be based on the fact that this hub has not yet been updated after a masterHub.AO has been changed.

Parameters:
thisHub -
Returns:
